member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ActivationExecutionContext
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the security context used by a procedure activated by the object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ActivationExecutionContext.ExecuteAsUser
member.summary: The activated procedure is executed with the security context of a specified user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ActivationExecutionContext.Owner
member.summary: The activated procedure is executed with the security context of the object owner.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ActivationExecutionContext.Self
member.summary: The activated procedure is executed with the security context of the object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AssemblyAlterOptions
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the addition options when altering an assembly. The values are bit flag values, and they may be combined by adding the values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AssemblyAlterOptions.NoChecks
member.summary: Value = 2. Information is still to come.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AssemblyAlterOptions.None
member.summary: Value = 0. No options are specified.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AssemblySecurityLevel
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the access rights for an assembly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AssemblySecurityLevel.External
member.summary: Value = 2. External access to the assembly is permitted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AssemblySecurityLevel.Safe
member.summary: Value = 1. Only safe access to the assembly is permitted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AssemblySecurityLevel.Unrestricted
member.summary: Value = 3. Unrestricted access to the assembly is permitted.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AsymmetricKeyEncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify an encryption algorithm used on an asymmetric key.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditLevel
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the Microsoft SQL Server audit level setting.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditLevel.All
member.summary: Audits both successful and failed login attempts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditLevel.Failure
member.summary: Audits failed login attempts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditLevel.None
member.summary: Does not audit login attempts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.AuditLevel.Success
member.summary: Audits successful login attempts.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupDeviceType
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the backup device type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupDeviceType.CDRom
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupDeviceType.Disk
member.summary: Device is a disk file created on the hard disk.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupDeviceType.FloppyA
member.summary: Device is a disk file created on the removable media in a floppy disk drive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupDeviceType.FloppyB
member.summary: Device is a disk file create on the removable media in drive B

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupDeviceType.Pipe
member.summary: Device is a named pipe.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupDeviceType.Tape
member.summary: Device is a tape drive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupDeviceType.Unknown
member.summary: Device type is not valid.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupSetFlag
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the backup set flags.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupSetFlag.MinimalLogData
member.summary: Specifies a database with minimal log data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupSetFlag.ReadOnlyDatabase
member.summary: Specifies a database that is read-only.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupSetFlag.SingleUserModeDatabase
member.summary: Specifies a database that is in single-user mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupSetFlag.WithSnapshot
member.summary: Specifies a database with a snapshot.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupSetType
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the backup device type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupSetType.Database
member.summary: A database backup set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupSetType.FileOrFileGroup
member.summary: A file or file group backup set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupSetType.Incremental
member.summary: An incremental backup set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.BackupSetType.Log
member.summary: A transaction log backup set.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationAction
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the method used to populate a full-text catalog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationAction.Full
member.summary: The entire catalog is fully populated, causing all index data to be retrieved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationAction.Incremental
member.summary: Only changed data will be indexed based on available time stamp data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify the status of the full-text catalog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus.CrawlinProgress
member.summary: Value = 1. Full-text index population is in progress for the referenced full-text catalog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus.DiskFullPause
member.summary: Value = 8. The disk is paused.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus.Idle
member.summary: Value = 0. No action is being performed on the referenced full-text catalog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus.Incremental
member.summary: Value = 6. Incremental index population is in progress for the referenced full-text catalog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus.Paused
member.summary: Value = 2. Lack of available resources has caused an interruption.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus.Recovering
member.summary: Value = 4. The population of the referenced full-text catalog is resuming after an interruption.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus.Shutdown
member.summary: Value = 5. The referenced full-text catalog is being deleted or is otherwise inaccessible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus.Throttled
member.summary: Value = 3. The Microsoft Search service has paused the index population of the referenced full-text catalog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CatalogPopulationStatus.UpdatingIndex
member.summary: Value = 7. The referenced full-text catalog is being assembled by the Search service. This is the final step in full-text catalog population.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ChangeTracking
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that are used to specify change tracking in a full-text index.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ChangeTracking.Automatic
member.summary: Automatic (background) change tracking.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ChangeTracking.Manual
member.summary: Manual change tracking.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ChangeTracking.Off
member.summary: Change tracking is disabled.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CompatibilityLevel
member.summary: The enumeration is a list of constant values that specify the behavior that corresponds to a version of Microsoft SQL Server.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CompatibilityLevel.Version60
member.summary: Behavior that corresponds to Microsoft SQL Server 6.0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CompatibilityLevel.Version65
member.summary: Behavior that corresponds to Microsoft SQL Server 6.5.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CompatibilityLevel.Version70
member.summary: Behavior that corresponds to Microsoft SQL Server 7.0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CompatibilityLevel.Version80
member.summary: Behavior that corresponds to Microsoft SQL Server 2000.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.CompatibilityLevel.Version90
member.summary: Behavior that corresponds to Microsoft SQL Server 2005.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ResourceUsage
member.summary: The enumeration contains values that specify the relative operating system execution priority setting for the Microsoft Search service.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ResourceUsage.AboveNormal
member.summary: Value = 4. Resource usage is above normal. Other processes may be impacted and consequently run slower.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ResourceUsage.Background
member.summary: Value = 1. Resource usage is set to the lowest priority. Full-text population time may take a long time.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ResourceUsage.BelowNormal
member.summary: Value = 2. Resource usage is below normal priority. This causes less impact on other processes but prolongs the population time of full-text indexes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ResourceUsage.Dedicated
member.summary: Value = 5. Resource usage is set to the highest priority. Other processes may not be given any time if full-text population is active.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ResourceUsage.Normal
member.summary: Value = 3. Resource usage is normal. Other processes share the system resources at normal levels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.ResourceUsage.Unknown
member.summary: Value = 0. The resource usage is unknown.

member.summary: The notification is sent over the network as an instant message to a computer and the message is displayed on the screen.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Agent.NotifyMethods.None
member.summary: There is no notification method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Agent.NotifyMethods.NotifyAll

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Agent.NotifyMethods.NotifyEmail

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Agent.NotifyMethods.Pager
member.summary: The notification is sent to a pager service by e-mail and the pager service send the message to the operator's pager.
